alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 7:15PM EDT until June 29 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: The National Weather Service in Caribou has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Piscataquis County in north central Maine... * Until 1015 PM EDT. * At 715 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain. Flash flooding is ongoing closing the Greenville & Elliotsville Road in Monson. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dover-Foxcroft, Guilford, Brownville Junction, Milo, Monson, Blanchard, Ebeemee, Elliottsville, Lake View Plantation, Kingsbury Plantation, Sangerville, Brownville, Parkman, Abbot, Sebec, Shirley, Willimantic, Bowerbank, Lake View and Seboeis. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
